description: The AWS::Rekognition::StreamProcessor type is used to create an Amazon Rekognition StreamProcessor that you can use to analyze streaming videos.

Arn.description: The ARN of the stream processor

KinesisVideoStream.description: The Kinesis Video Stream that streams the source video.

Arn.description: ARN of the Kinesis Video Stream that streams the source video.

S3Destination.description: The S3 location in customer's account where inference output & artifacts are stored, as part of connected home feature.

ObjectKeyPrefix.description: The object key prefix path where the results will be stored. Default is no prefix path

KinesisDataStream.description: The Amazon Kinesis Data Stream stream to which the Amazon Rekognition stream processor streams the analysis results, as part of face search feature.

Arn.description: ARN of the Kinesis Data Stream stream.

Labels.description: List of labels that need to be detected in the video stream. Current supported values are PERSON, PET, PACKAGE, ALL.

ConnectedHomeSettings.description: Connected home settings to use on a streaming video. Note that either ConnectedHomeSettings or FaceSearchSettings should be set. Not both

MinConfidence.description: Minimum object class match confidence score that must be met to return a result for a recognized object.

FaceSearchSettings.description: Face search settings to use on a streaming video. Note that either FaceSearchSettings or ConnectedHomeSettings should be set. Not both

CollectionId.description: The ID of a collection that contains faces that you want to search for.

FaceMatchThreshold.description: Minimum face match confidence score percentage that must be met to return a result for a recognized face. The default is 80. 0 is the lowest confidence. 100 is the highest confidence. Values between 0 and 100 are accepted.

NotificationChannel.description: The ARN of the SNS notification channel where events of interests are published, as part of connected home feature.

Point.description: An (X, Y) cartesian coordinate denoting a point on the frame

X.description: The X coordinate of the point.

Y.description: The Y coordinate of the point.

Polygon.description: A polygon showing a region of interest. Note that the ordering of the Point entries matter in defining the polygon

BoundingBox.description: A bounding box denoting a region of interest in the frame to be analyzed.

DataSharingPreference.description: Indicates whether Rekognition is allowed to store the video stream data for model-training.

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

Key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

Value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

Name.description: Name of the stream processor. It's an identifier you assign to the stream processor. You can use it to manage the stream processor.

KmsKeyId.description: The KMS key that is used by Rekognition to encrypt any intermediate customer metadata and store in the customer's S3 bucket.

RoleArn.description: ARN of the IAM role that allows access to the stream processor, and provides Rekognition read permissions for KVS stream and write permissions to S3 bucket and SNS topic.

PolygonRegionsOfInterest.description: The PolygonRegionsOfInterest specifies a set of polygon areas of interest in the video frames to analyze, as part of connected home feature. Each polygon is in turn, an ordered list of Point

BoundingBoxRegionsOfInterest.description: The BoundingBoxRegionsOfInterest specifies an array of bounding boxes of interest in the video frames to analyze, as part of connected home feature. If an object is partially in a region of interest, Rekognition will tag it as detected if the overlap of the object with the region-of-interest is greater than 20%.

Status.description: Current status of the stream processor.

StatusMessage.description: Detailed status message about the stream processor.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

$comment: We explicitly specify the replacement strategy to be delete_then_create because we cannot create a new SP resource with the same name or same KVS input before deleting the old one
